document.discussion_title: Netflix, Inc. (NFLX) Earns “Hold” Rating from SunTrust
document.topic_text: Tweet Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) ‘s stock had its “hold” rating reaffirmed by research analysts at SunTrust in a note issued to investors on Monday, MarketBeat.com reports. Several large investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Churchill Management raised its stake in Netflix by 1.0% in the fourth quarter. Churchill Management now owns 8,257 shares of the Internet television network’s stock valued at $944,000 after buying an additional 81 shares during the last quarter. Vanguard Group Inc. raised its stake in Netflix by 3.1% in the fourth quarter. Vanguard Group Inc. now owns 23,840,599 shares of the Internet television network’s stock valued at $2,726,888,000 after buying an additional 714,832 shares during the last quarter. J. W. Burns & Company raised its stake in Netflix by 7.2% in the fourth quarter. J. W. Burns & Company now owns 24,679 shares of the Internet television network’s stock valued at $2,823,000 after buying an additional 1,661 shares during the last quarter. Visium Asset Management LP purchased a new stake in Netflix during the fourth quarter valued at $1,573,000. Finally, BKS Advisors LLC raised its stake in Netflix by 61.5% in the fourth quarter. BKS Advisors LLC now owns 10,796 shares of the Internet television network’s stock valued at $1,235,000 after buying an additional 4,110 shares during the last quarter. In other Netflix news, Director Richard N. Barton sold 1,400 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Wednesday, February 10th. The shares were sold at an average price of $87.22, for a total value of $122,108.00. Following the sale, the director now owns 14,862 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $1,296,263.64. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at this link . Also, CEO Reed Hastings sold 81,816 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction dated Wednesday, April 20th. The stock was sold at an average price of $95.80, for a total transaction of $7,837,972.80. Following the completion of the sale, the chief executive officer now directly owns 81,816 shares in the company, valued at approximately $7,837,972.80. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . A number of other research analysts have also recently commented on NFLX. Needham & Company LLC restated a “buy” rating on shares of Netflix in a research note on Sunday, December 27th. Vetr cut Netflix from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $131.42 target price for the company. in a research note on Tuesday, December 29th. Robert W. Baird cut Netflix from an “outperform” rating to a “neutral” rating and lowered their target price for the company from $128.00 to $115.00 in a research note on Monday, January 4th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Zacks Investment Research cut Netflix from a “hold” rating to a “sell” rating in a research note on Monday, January 4th. Finally, Pacific Crest restated an “overweight” rating and issued a $140.00 target price on shares of Netflix in a research note on Tuesday, January 5th. Six analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, fourteen have issued a hold rating and twenty-eight have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and an average target price of $126.02. Shares of Netflix ( NASDAQ:NFLX ) traded down 2.75% during mid-day trading on Monday, hitting $93.26. 11,228,717 shares of the company were exchanged. The company has a market capitalization of $39.92 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 333.07. The firm has a 50 day moving average of $101.45 and a 200 day moving average of $106.07. Netflix has a 12-month low of $78.89 and a 12-month high of $133.27. Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) last released its earnings results on Monday, April 18th. The Internet television network reported $0.06 EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.03 by $0.03. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business earned $0.77 EPS. The firm earned $1.96 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $1.97 billion. The company’s revenue for the quarter was up 24.5% compared to the same quarter last year. Equities research analysts forecast that Netflix will post $0.28 earnings per share for the current year. Netflix, Inc is a provider of Internet television network. The Company has over 57 million streaming members in over 50 countries. Its members can watch more than two billion hours of television ( NASDAQ:NFLX ) shows and movies per month, including original series, documentaries and feature films on Internet-connected screen. Receive News & Ratings for Netflix Inc. Netflix Inc.
